entry.title: Using gropuby to remove 'data islands'
entry.content: As anyone who has worked with measurement data knows, there is always some amount of missing and errornous data, hence quality control is an essential step. However, automatic quality control methods remove additional data and are imperfect, often resulting in the new data set containing many short periods of questionable data called ‘data islands’. In this blog post, I’ll show you how you can remove data islands, based on by specifying a minimum period length.

entry.title: pvlib - a one stop source for solar resource data
entry.content: This title at least represents the aim of my Google Summer of Code (GSoC) project that I will be completing during the next 10 weeks. In short, I’ll be extending pvlib python’s current iotools functionalities to provide users with easy and standardized access to all major open-source solar resource databases.
